content.question: The development of the early nineteenth-century concept of “separate spheres” for the sexes encouraged all of the following EXCEPT

choices.label: accepting women as intellectual equals of men
idealizing the home as a haven in a competitive world
designating the home as the appropriate place for a woman
emphasizing childrearing as a prime duty of a woman
establishing a moral climate in the home

content.answer: accepting women as intellectual equals of men

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
